intro: Gmelinia, commonly known as the false heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plants are characterized by their small, showy flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. They often grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Gmelinia species are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their compact growth and attractive foliage.
